definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to move out (vacate)/to shift sth out
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to fiddle with/to play and move sth about/to show off (what one can do)/to parade (one's capabilities)/to cause trouble
to apply mechanically/to copy and use
to call for reinforcements/to bring in troops
to pass on stories (idiom); to sow dissension/to blab/to tell tales

sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的时候手指头上扎了一根刺。

sentences.english: The night watchman brought the armchair for Hewson. He tried to make him laugh.
sentences.chinese: 守夜人给休森搬来了一张椅子，顺便逗一下他。

sentences.english: He put the crouch-back♠ onstage, and sold tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个驼背怪物搬上台，卖票给人看。

sentences.english: Over the next few years, the couple worked, raised their children—Isabel andEli, who were seven and ten years old when their grandfather moved in—and cared for Winokur’s father.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的祖父搬来时他们分别有7岁和10岁。

sentences.english: In the first few years after I moved there, lotus flowers continued to blossom on the surface of the pond.
sentences.chinese: 刚搬来的几年，池塘里还有荷花。

sentences.english: John couldn't even pick up the box, much less carry it upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 约翰连这箱子提都提不起来，更别说把它搬上楼了。

sentences.english: and they moved to America first, had my eldest sister.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们搬去了美国，生下了我的大姐姐。

sentences.english: He moved to northern New Mexico shortly after graduating in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 1969年毕业后不久，他搬到新墨西哥州北部。

sentences.english: This box is very light, and I move.
There's the U-Haul I rented to move your things.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个我租过来搬你东西的U型拖车。

sentences.english: No one can move the sofa single-handed.
" he then rented it out and moved to Cape Town.
sentences.chinese: ，他将这栋别墅租赁出去后搬到了开普敦。

sentences.english: I experienced the same thing when i moved to Amerika .
sentences.chinese: 当我搬到美国时，我经历过同样的事情。

sentences.english: Guyer downsized to a small house from a more luxurious one.
sentences.chinese: 盖勒要比较从奢侈的大房子搬到小房子里去了。

sentences.english: Get a new roommate or move to a new place.
sentences.chinese: 交到一个新室友或者搬去一个新地方。

sentences.english: Most strong-bodied man as he is, he can't move the big stone.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然是最强壮的，但他也搬不动那块大石头。

definition: to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to lift/to carry in one's hand/Taiwan pr. [ling1]
to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
